results.title: Psoriasiform rash possibly induced by oral propranolol in a 12-month-old girl with infantile hemangioma: a case report and literature review.
results.text_hl: The @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ was switched to @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, which resulted in improvement of the @DISEASE_Hemangioma @DISEASE_MESH:D006391 @@@hemangioma@@@ and complete resolution of the @<m>DISEASE_Skin_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012871 @@@skin lesions@@@.

citations.NLM: Alruhaimi S, Alowirdi F, Al-Ajroush W. Psoriasiform rash possibly induced by oral propranolol in a 12-month-old girl with infantile hemangioma: a case report and literature review. Dermatol Reports. 2025 Mar 5;():. PMID: 40047218

results.title: Fixed drug eruption due to atenolol: a case report.
results.text_hl: However, adverse @<m>DISEASE_Skin_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012871 @@@skin reactions@@@ are very rare.

results.title: Relationship between amount of beta-blockers permeating through the stratum corneum and skin irritation after application of beta-blocker adhesive patches to guinea pig skin.
results.text_hl: We evaluated the relationship between the cumulative amounts of 5 kinds of beta-blockers (@CHEMICAL_Alprenolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000526 @@@alprenolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Oxprenolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010096 @@@oxprenolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Timolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013999 @@@timolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Acebutolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000070 @@@acebutolol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@) permeating through the stratum corneum and a* values obtained by measuring the formation of @DISEASE_Erythema @DISEASE_MESH:D004890 @@@erythema@@@, a @<m>DISEASE_Skin_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012871 @@@skin irritation@@@ reaction, with a chromameter after transdermal application of adhesive patches containing 2 beta-blocker to the skin of @SPECIES_10141 @@@guinea pigs@@@.

citations.NLM: Kobayashi I, Hosaka K, Ueno T, Maruo H, Kamiyama M, Konno C, Gemba M. Relationship between amount of beta-blockers permeating through the stratum corneum and skin irritation after application of beta-blocker adhesive patches to guinea pig skin. Biol Pharm Bull. 1997 Apr;20(4):421-7. PMID: 9145222
citations.BibTeX: @article{9145222, title={Relationship between amount of beta-blockers permeating through the stratum corneum and skin irritation after application of beta-blocker adhesive patches to guinea pig skin.}, author={Kobayashi I and Hosaka K and Ueno T and Maruo H and Kamiyama M and Konno C and Gemba M}, journal={Biol Pharm Bull}, volume={20}, number={4}, pages={421-7}}

results.title: Sweat-gland necrosis after beta-adrenergic antagonist treatment in a patient with pheochromocytoma.
results.text_hl: There were @<m>DISEASE_Skin_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012871 @@@acral skin lesions@@@, histologically characterized by epidermal and @DISEASE_Sweat_Gland_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D013543 @@@sweat-gland necrosis@@@.
